Continuing straight off of the first Portal, Portal 2 combines a great atmosphere, an added lore, and humerus characters to the already amazing franchise. But a puzzle game ain't great if it ain't at least a little difficult. First, second, third, and fourth time playing this game you'll find yourself scratching your head and getting a bit stumped on some of the mechanics. In plain the campaign is magnificent, with added easter eggs on the occasional level for more background in a subplot. The added community test chambers gives this triple A game more room to breathe and more challenges to overcome, only limited by what veterans of this franchise can think of.
The hardest pill to swallow about Portal 2 would have to come from its Cooperative play. It can be a little boring compared to the campaign and lacks any good ground to find myself coming back to it; However Portal 2 once again cleans this smudge by allowing its player base free reign to create its own tests to challenge other players.
This is my first review, but I felt obligated to give it to Portal 2. This game has done wonders for me, and always reels me back in when I think about uninstalling it. If you're a mechanical player like I am, you'll love this game.
8/10 - Good Campaign, Good Visuals, Good Story, Fun Actors, Overestimated, but understated Co-op

Portal 2 is an amazing game with a decent number of hours.
Its only downside, you can bassically only play the storyline once. It makes up for this though with a vast range of different levels created by players all around the world.
In your first play through of the game the puzzles get even harder than portal's first puzzles. The storyline is absolutely amazing with plot twists around every portal, and its an all togethor great game.
